object.?sub-obj…
@neilbowers Yep, that's the thing. Kinda of like spam, but made of fish.

@neilbowers Surimi doesn't look as good either. I added also a bit of spelt flour for consistency. And I'm letting it simmer for a long time, like 20 minutes. Still simmering, as a matter of fact... We like things spicy, so there was a bit of smashed cayenned added before starting to fry.

@neilbowers It's not going so bad https://t.co/HLRYMWaWVX First lesson: it's better if you stock up on the codfish in advance. Surimi is not bad, but not great either. I was just trying to use up some salted codfish that had been marooned for some time in the fridge.
RT @ramix: My contribution with Perl6 Advent Calendar: Web server from scratch with Cro and Debian https://t.co/YczZGHkZWy #perl6 #debian #…

But the main thing is that to keep a community alive, you need to create meaningful ways for that community to interact, and checking out and working on other people's code is a great way to do that. So I thank @neilbowers for undertaking this. 😍 https://t.co/xXVuPIrL5i

It's been a great ride, and I've interacted with many excellent programmers and learned a lot from their coding, module creation, and interaction with contributors style. I've also learned that no piece of code is perfect and there's always room for improvement. https://t.co/6zoBuqa2D7

This is the last month of the #perl pull request challenge, and after submitting my last PR (thanks @davorg for accepting it so fast), @neilbowers, who's been the excellent MC (master of challenges) for 4 years, has been so kind to send me mi contribution history #perl https://t.co/XFI1Y3MZvn

Developers: Pleas…
@raiph_mellor @nojhan That would be an interesting academic exercise. But, I mean, pyexcel is already there. And there are (many) other priorities in the #perl6 module ecosystem right now...

@raiph_mellor @nojhan Well... There's no multi-spreadsheet module in Perl 6. I could use Inline-Python and then the rest... But doing it in Python was just as fast, and more straighforward, so that's what I used.

@Escabia12 Bueno, JSP era algo ya complicado en su época. Con procesos modernos puede mejorar algo, epro sigue siendo una tecnología, con los servlets y demás, que vale para lo que vale... Está una generación más atrás que los frameworks MVC y dos o tres de los microframeworks...
@Escabia12 Si usas tecnologías de hace 20 años con metodologías de desarrollo de hace 20 años, tienes casi garantizado que algo va a salir mal tarde o temprano. Y siempre sale...
